content.question: Students are told that a spherical mirror will project an image on a screen at a distance <math alttext="s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mirror when an object is placed at a distance <math alttext="s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mirror. The students have been asked to develop an experimental method for determining the focal length of the mirror. Which of the following describes the best method to find the focal length of the mirror?

choices.label: Measure the height of the object <math alttext="h sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the height of the image <math alttext="h sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for an object at distance <math alttext="s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Multiplying <math alttext="h sub i, over h sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub><mo>/</mo><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> by the object distance <math alttext="s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will give the focal length of the mirror.

Measure the radius of curvature of the mirror and multiply by the image distance <math alttext="s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The product is the focal length of the mirror.

Measure the image distance <math alttext="s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for several different object distances and plot <math alttext="s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The slope of the best-fit line is the focal length of the mirror.
Direct a beam of light along the axis of the mirror and move the screen until a point of light is formed. This point will be a focal length away from the mirror.

content.answer: Direct a beam of light along the axis of the mirror and move the screen until a point of light is formed. This point will be a focal length away from the mirror.
